snp1.2:18: “I’ve boiled my rice, I’ve milked the cows,”“I dwell with my family near the bank of the Mahī.My hut is thatched, the fire is kindled:so if you wish, pour down, O sky god!” (1)
snp1.2:19: “I don’t boil with anger, I’m rid of barrenness,”“I dwell one night near the bank of the Mahī,my hut open, my fire extinguished:so if you wish, pour down, O sky god!” (2)
snp1.2:20: “No gadflies or mosquitoes are found,”“The cows roam in the meadow lush with grass.They can endure the rain when it comes:so if you wish, pour down, O sky god!” (3)
snp1.2:21: “I made a raft that is well constructed,”“I have crossed, gone beyond, escaped the flood.I have no more need for a raft:so if you wish, pour down, O sky god!” (4) [4]
snp1.2:22: “My wife is obedient, not wanton,”“Living together with me long, she is agreeable,and I do not hear any evil about her:so if you wish, pour down, O sky god!” (5)
snp1.2:23: “My mind is obedient, liberated,”“It’s been long nurtured and well tamed;further, no evil is found in me:so if you wish, pour down, O sky god!” (6)
snp1.2:24: “I am employed by myself,”“and my children, living close by, are healthy;I do not hear any evil about them:so if you wish, pour down, O sky god!” (7)
snp1.2:25: “I am not employed by anyone,”“I wander in all the world by what I’ve earned.I have no need at all for wages:so if you wish, pour down, O sky god!” (8)
snp1.2:26: “There are cows and suckling calves,”“There are cows with calf and breeding cows;there is also a bull, chief of cattle, here:Reading withEeandBegavampatīdha atthi, as againstEegavampatī ca atthi. Norman too prefersgavampatīdha; seeGD149–50.so if you wish, pour down, O sky god!” (9)
snp1.2:27: “There are no cows or suckling calves,”“no cows with calf or breeding cows. [5]There’s not even a bull, chief of cattle, here:so if you wish, pour down, O sky god!” (10)
snp1.2:28: “The stakes are planted, unshakable,”“The muñja grass halters are new and well shaped;not even the sucklings can break them:so if you wish, pour down, O sky god!” (11)
snp1.2:29: “Like a bull I have cut through the bonds,”“Like an elephant I have sundered the rotten creeper.I will never again come to the bed of the womb:so if you wish, pour down, O sky god!” (12)
snp1.2:30: Filling the lowland and highland,at once a great cloud poured down rain.Having heard the rain falling,Dhaniya spoke about this matter: (13)
snp1.2:31: “It is indeed no small gain for us,that we have seen the Blessed One.We approach you as a refuge, One with Vision:be our teacher, great muni. (14)
snp1.2:32: “My wife and I, obedient, would leadthe spiritual life under the Fortunate One.Gone beyond birth and death,we would make an end of suffering.” (15) [6]
snp1.2:33: “One who has sons delights because of sons,”“One with cattle delights because of cattle.For acquisitions are a man’s delight;without acquisitions one does not delight.” (16)
snp1.2:34: “One who has sons sorrows because of sons,”“One with cattle likewise sorrows because of cattle.For acquisitions are a man’s sorrow;without acquisitions one does not sorrow.” (17)
